title: Sri Lanka bond yields up, rupee quoted at 280/310 to dollar
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond market remains inactive on Wednesday (23) despite the weekly bills auction yields moving up dealers said, while the rupee was quoted around 280/310 to the US dollar in late trading.
The rupee was quoted as weak a 295/325 to the US dollar but there is no active trading in the spot market.
Commercial Banks were offering to sell dollars for telegraphic transfers at 290 rupees and was buying at 275 rupees Wednesday.
“The bond market is dull however at the auction yields moved up,” brokers said.
In the secondary market, the only liquid bond maturing on 01.08.2024 closed at 14.50/15.00 percent on Wednesday, up from 14.30/40 percent a day earlier.
Sri Lanka’s debt office offered and sold 56.5 billion rupees in bills in an auction held on Wednesday.
The bills were split into 20 billion maturing in 3-months, 15 billion in 6-months and 21.5 billion in 1-year.
Three months bills moved up 75 basis points, 6-months moved up 93 basis points and 1-years up 85 basis points.
In the money market, the central bank was quoting an indicative spot rate of 280.42 dollars, up from 280.00 dollars, a day earlier.
Market participants said the rupee is quoted around 295/325 against the dollar.
Commercial banks were offering to sell dollars at 284.99 rupees for telegraphic transfer and buy at 274.99 rupees on Wednesday.
